meanings.definition: To make (something) less dry by adding liquid or lotion.
meanings.sent1: I always moisturized my skin after a shower to keep it soft and hydrated.
meanings.sent2: She moisturized her hands with lotion to prevent them from becoming dry.
meanings.sent3: The desert was so dry that even the cacti needed to be moisturized regularly.
meanings.sent4: His kind words moisturized her heart, making her feel loved and cared for.
meanings.sent5: The rain moisturized the thirsty earth, bringing life to the barren land.

meanings.sent1: The freshly baked bread was so moist and moisturized, it melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent2: Her hair looked shiny and moisturized after using a nourishing conditioner.
meanings.sent3: The sponge cake was so moisturized that it practically oozed with deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: The plants in the greenhouse were all lush and moisturized, thriving in the humid environment.
meanings.sent5: The air in the bathroom felt warm and moisturized after a hot shower, creating a cozy atmosphere.
